message.content: This question involves understanding the properties of gases and the behavior of air. When a person blows air into a balloon, the air fills the balloon and creates pressure inside. When the person then releases the air from the balloon into a soccer ball, the air expands to fill the larger space. This is known as the ability of gas to conform to the volume of its container. Option (A) is incorrect because the question is not related to the laws of thermodynamics. Option (C) is incorrect because a shift in the cosmos does not explain the behavior of air in this scenario. Option (D) is incorrect because only option (B) correctly explains the phenomenon.

This question requires an understanding of basic physics and the behavior of gases. When a person blows into a balloon, the air they exhale fills up the balloon. Similarly, when they blow into a soccer ball, the same air can be used to fill it. This is because gases, like air, are able to expand and fill the space available to them. Option (A), the law of thermodynamics, is incorrect because it does not specifically explain this phenomenon. Option (C), a shift in the cosmos, is unrelated to the behavior of gases. Option (D) is incorrect because only option (B), the ability of air to conform, directly explains why the same air can be used to fill both objects.
